channel.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
channel.description:
Okay well... I'm getting random numbers which are flooding my CMD prompt, it looks somewhat like this..
[code] 1 18 12 4 7 3 8 1 11 9 1 4 2 5 14[/code]
And so on... It happens like 10 times a second or something and I tried every thing to stop it, it's lagging my server.. Can anyone help?

item.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
item.dc:creator: @IamGretar IamGretar
item.description:
@IamGretar wrote:

You don’t know how much i love you

Read full topic

item.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

Here

[code]package server.model.players.packets;

import java.io.RandomAccessFile;
import java.nio.MappedByteBuffer;
import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;

public class WalkingHandler {

    public static final int WIDTH = 12000;
    public static final int HEIGHT = 9900;

    private final TiledMap map;

    public WalkingHandler() {
            this.map = new TiledMap(WIDTH, HEIGHT);
    }

    private static class SingletonContainer {
            private static final WalkingHandler SINGLETON = new WalkingHandler();
    }

    public static WalkingHandler getSingleton() {
            return SingletonContainer.SINGLETON;
    }

    public boolean traversable(int x, int y, int direction) {
            int flag = map.getFlag(x, y);
    //System.out.println(direction);
    if (direction == 0 && (flag == 1 || flag == 4 || flag == 6 || flag == 7 || flag == 9 || flag == 11 || flag == 13 || flag == 14)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 4 && (flag == 1 || flag == 7 || flag == 15 || flag == 10 || flag == 11 || flag == 12 || flag == 14 || flag == 5)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 8 && (flag == 1 || flag == 2 || flag == 3 || flag == 4 || flag == 5 || flag == 6 || flag == 7 || flag == 12)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 12 && (flag == 1 || flag == 3 || flag == 6 || flag == 9 || flag == 10 || flag == 11 || flag == 12 || flag == 8)) {
        return false;
    } else if(flag > 0 && flag < 15) {
                    return false;
            }
    return true;
    }


    public void initialize() throws Exception {
            long delta = System.currentTimeMillis();
            RandomAccessFile raf = new RandomAccessFile("data/lolmap.bin", "r");
            FileChannel channel = raf.getChannel();
            MappedByteBuffer buffer = channel.map(FileChannel.MapMode.READ_ONLY, 0, channel.size());
            int length = buffer.getInt();
            for(int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
                    int x = buffer.getShort();
                    int y = buffer.getShort();
                    byte flag = buffer.get();
                    map.flag(x, y, flag);
            }
            //System.out.println("Loaded clipmap in " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - delta) + "ms.");
    }

    private static class TiledMap {
   
            private final byte[] plane;

            public TiledMap(int width, int height) {
                    this.plane = new byte[width * 10000 + height];
            }

            public int getFlag(int x, int y) {
                    return plane[x * 10000 + y];
            }

            public void flag(int x, int y, byte flag) {
                    this.plane[x * 10000 + y] = flag;
            }

    }

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

[quote=“IamGretar, post:7, topic:415752”]Hey guys my walking handler looks like this could you change this for me ?

[code]package server.model.players.packets;

import java.io.RandomAccessFile;
import java.nio.MappedByteBuffer;
import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;

public class WalkingHandler {

public static final int WIDTH = 12000;
public static final int HEIGHT = 9900;

private final TiledMap map;

public WalkingHandler() {
	this.map = new TiledMap(WIDTH, HEIGHT);
}

private static class SingletonContainer {
	private static final WalkingHandler SINGLETON = new WalkingHandler();
}

public static WalkingHandler getSingleton() {
	return SingletonContainer.SINGLETON;
}

public boolean traversable(int x, int y, int direction) {
	int flag = map.getFlag(x, y);
System.out.println(direction);
    if (direction == 0 && (flag == 1 || flag == 4 || flag == 6 || flag == 7 || flag == 9 || flag == 11 || flag == 13 || flag == 14)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 4 && (flag == 1 || flag == 7 || flag == 15 || flag == 10 || flag == 11 || flag == 12 || flag == 14 || flag == 5)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 8 && (flag == 1 || flag == 2 || flag == 3 || flag == 4 || flag == 5 || flag == 6 || flag == 7 || flag == 12)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 12 && (flag == 1 || flag == 3 || flag == 6 || flag == 9 || flag == 10 || flag == 11 || flag == 12 || flag == 8)) {
        return false;
    } else if(flag > 0 && flag < 15) {
		return false;
	}
    return true;
}


public void initialize() throws Exception {
	long delta = System.currentTimeMillis();
	RandomAccessFile raf = new RandomAccessFile("data/lolmap.bin", "r");
	FileChannel channel = raf.getChannel();
	MappedByteBuffer buffer = channel.map(FileChannel.MapMode.READ_ONLY, 0, channel.size());
	int length = buffer.getInt();
	for(int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
		int x = buffer.getShort();
		int y = buffer.getShort();
		byte flag = buffer.get();
		map.flag(x, y, flag);
	}
	//System.out.println("Loaded clipmap in " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - delta) + "ms.");
}

private static class TiledMap {

	private final byte[] plane;

	public TiledMap(int width, int height) {
		this.plane = new byte[width * 10000 + height];
	}

	public int getFlag(int x, int y) {
		return plane[x * 10000 + y];
	}

	public void flag(int x, int y, byte flag) {
		this.plane[x * 10000 + y] = flag;
	}

}

}[/code][/quote]
Why are you spamming this guys thread? And what needs to be changed?

Read full topic

item.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
item.dc:creator: @IamGretar IamGretar
item.description:
@IamGretar wrote:

Hey guys my walking handler looks like this could you change this for me ?

[code]package server.model.players.packets;

import java.io.RandomAccessFile;
import java.nio.MappedByteBuffer;
import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;

public class WalkingHandler {

public static final int WIDTH = 12000;
public static final int HEIGHT = 9900;

private final TiledMap map;

public WalkingHandler() {
	this.map = new TiledMap(WIDTH, HEIGHT);
}

private static class SingletonContainer {
	private static final WalkingHandler SINGLETON = new WalkingHandler();
}

public static WalkingHandler getSingleton() {
	return SingletonContainer.SINGLETON;
}

public boolean traversable(int x, int y, int direction) {
	int flag = map.getFlag(x, y);
System.out.println(direction);
    if (direction == 0 && (flag == 1 || flag == 4 || flag == 6 || flag == 7 || flag == 9 || flag == 11 || flag == 13 || flag == 14)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 4 && (flag == 1 || flag == 7 || flag == 15 || flag == 10 || flag == 11 || flag == 12 || flag == 14 || flag == 5)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 8 && (flag == 1 || flag == 2 || flag == 3 || flag == 4 || flag == 5 || flag == 6 || flag == 7 || flag == 12)) {
        return false;
    } else if (direction == 12 && (flag == 1 || flag == 3 || flag == 6 || flag == 9 || flag == 10 || flag == 11 || flag == 12 || flag == 8)) {
        return false;
    } else if(flag > 0 && flag < 15) {
		return false;
	}
    return true;
}


public void initialize() throws Exception {
	long delta = System.currentTimeMillis();
	RandomAccessFile raf = new RandomAccessFile("data/lolmap.bin", "r");
	FileChannel channel = raf.getChannel();
	MappedByteBuffer buffer = channel.map(FileChannel.MapMode.READ_ONLY, 0, channel.size());
	int length = buffer.getInt();
	for(int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
		int x = buffer.getShort();
		int y = buffer.getShort();
		byte flag = buffer.get();
		map.flag(x, y, flag);
	}
	//System.out.println("Loaded clipmap in " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - delta) + "ms.");
}

private static class TiledMap {

	private final byte[] plane;

	public TiledMap(int width, int height) {
		this.plane = new byte[width * 10000 + height];
	}

	public int getFlag(int x, int y) {
		return plane[x * 10000 + y];
	}

	public void flag(int x, int y, byte flag) {
		this.plane[x * 10000 + y] = flag;
	}

}

}[/code]

item.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:4, topic:415752”]No its not ‘lagging’ your server, its the overload x server? Right, overloadx is a bad base to use, all the numbers are just the clipped NPC data, from the config file, remove the ‘System.out.println(something);’
in walkinghandler[/quote]

Thank you very much, its fixed now. And its not overload x, its a different base but I just didn’t realize where the numbers were coming from.

Read full topic

item.title: Random Numbers Flooding CMD?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

No its not ‘lagging’ your server, its the overload x server? Right, overloadx is a bad base to use, all the numbers are just the clipped NPC data, from the config file, remove the ‘System.out.println(something);’
in walkinghandler
